page.title: 01The Brockhampton Area
page.content: This area covers the parish of {Brockhampton,}much of the{Whitbourne Parish is within the study area. The steep,hilly,wooded land to the west rises almost to Bromyard Downs.To the east Whitbourne lies in a flatter valley floor with woodland becoming less extensive. The north and south boundaries of this valley are hilly and steep,with Badley Wood Common is to the north and Bringsty Common to the south. Several large houses dominate the area Whitbourne Hall,The Gaines and Brockhampton House.Lower Brockhampton being the jewel of the area is almost centrally placed,hidden in the valley floor.The area exudes peace, beauty and tranquility, this is it's attraction.THe surrounding wood- lands and rhododendrom-lined streams provide a most beautiful setting.
